title.narrative: Winterization relief for people affected by the crisis in Eastern Ukraine

description.narrative: Distribution of Heating materials as part of winterization relief

Since the regime of Yanukovych was ousted, Ukraine has faced with significant challenges such as the armed conflict with pro-Russian military groups and transitional period characterized by political and socio-economic instability. Since the beginning of the conflict, death count has exceeded 10,000 including 2,493 civilians while number of injured citizens has reached 9,000. The transitional period focused on democratic reforms is flowing slowly because the old system is deeply rooted in the practices of governance. Moreover, the process is influenced by a low level of trust in the Ukraine government by the population. In parallel, the armed clashes transformed into the protracted conflict with periodical increasing of hostilities has directly impacted on exhausting resources on national as well as household level. Consequently, depletion of income opportunities and rising living costs have affected the quality of life and increased social tension among people. The level of poverty rose from 20 to 74% in Luhansk and from 22 to 65% in Donetsk from 2013 to 2015 due to conflict. Affected by the above mentioned circumstances, Ukrainian government has limited ability to improve the humanitarian situation and alleviate people’s suffering in the east of Ukraine.
